t: Matthew 17
And*p after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,
And*p was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.
And,*p behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.
Then*p answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
While*p he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.
And*p when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.
And*p Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise,*r and*r be*r not*r afraid.*r
And*p when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.
And*p as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell*r the*r vision*r to*r no*r man,*r until*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r risen*r again*r from*r the*r dead.*r
And*p his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?
And*p Jesus answered and said unto them, Elias*r truly*r shall*r first*r come,*r and*r restore*r all*r things.*r

But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r Elias*r is*r come*r already,*r and*r they*r knew*r him*r not,*r but*r have*r done*r unto*r him*r whatsoever*r they*r listed.*r Likewise*r shall*r also*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r suffer*r of*r them.*r
Then*p the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.
And*p when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a certain man, kneeling down to him, and saying,
Lord,*p have mercy on my son: for he is lunatic, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.
And*p I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.
Then*p Jesus answered and said, O*r faithless*r and*r perverse*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r suffer*r you?*r bring*r him*r hither*r to*r me.*r
And*p Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.
Then*p came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

And*p Jesus said unto them, Because*r of*r your*r unbelief:*r for*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r If*r ye*r have*r faith*r as*r a*r grain*r of*r mustard*r seed,*r ye*r shall*r say*r unto*r this*r mountain,*r Remove*r hence*r to*r yonder*r place;*r and*r it*r shall*r remove;*r and*r nothing*r shall*r be*r impossible*r unto*r you.*r
Howbeit*rp this*r kind*r goeth*r not*r out*r but*r by*r prayer*r and*r fasting.*r
And*p while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men:*r
And*rp they*r shall*r kill*r him,*r and*r the*r third*r day*r he*r shall*r be*r raised*r again.*r And they were exceeding sorry.
And*p when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tribute money came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?

He*p saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What*r thinkest*r thou,*r Simon?*r of*r whom*r do*r the*r kings*r of*r the*r earth*r take*r custom*r or*r tribute?*r of*r their*r own*r children,*r or*r of*r strangers?*r
Peter*p saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him, Then*r are*r the*r children*r free.*r

Notwithstanding,*rp lest*r we*r should*r offend*r them,*r go*r thou*r to*r the*r sea,*r and*r cast*r an*r hook,*r and*r take*r up*r the*r fish*r that*r first*r cometh*r up;*r and*r when*r thou*r hast*r opened*r his*r mouth,*r thou*r shalt*r find*r a*r piece*r of*r money:*r that*r take,*r and*r give*r unto*r them*r for*r me*r and*r thee.*r
